benchmark_details.name: Blueprint-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: Blueprint-Bench is a benchmark designed to evaluate spatial reasoning capabilities in AI models through the task of converting apartment photographs into accurate 2D floor plans.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of Blueprint-Bench is to measure the spatial intelligence of models that are not specifically trained for spatial reasoning tasks.

data.source: The dataset contains 50 apartments, each with approximately 20 images of the interior, alongside ground truth floor plans adapted from official listings.
data.annotation: Images were annotated based on strict formatting rules for floor plans.

metrics: Similarity score based on room connectivity graphs
methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on the similarity between generated and ground-truth floor plans by evaluating room connectivity, size rank, and other components.
methodology.interpretation: A score of 1 indicates a perfect match, while a score of 0 indicates no similarity.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance serves as a baseline, with AI models typically performing at or below a random baseline.
methodology.validation: Blueprint-Bench will continue to be updated with new models and community submissions for ongoing evaluation.
